content.title: Financial Assistance To Institutions/Societies Belonging To Scheduled Castes/Backward Classes
content.department: Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes Department, Government of Haryana
content.beneficiary: Institutions/Societies of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance to Institutions/Societies Belonging to Scheduled Castes/Backward Classes' was launched to provide financial assistance to enable institutions/societies to construct/complete/repair/renovate buildings for community social or educational purposes.
benefits: Financial Assistance up to ₹2.00 lakhs may be sanctioned by the Minister in charge.
The Chief Minister may sanction grants exceeding ₹2.00 lakhs in genuine cases.
In deserving cases, additional funds can also be sanctioned later on.
eligibility: Only those institutions/societies of Scheduled Castes/Backward classes registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860, or the Indian Trust Act.
The society/institution should have at least 100 sq yards of its own land or allotted/donated to it.
Second-time grants to the same institution will be given after five years if all UCs for earlier grants have been submitted.
documents_required: Attested copies of the registration certificate of the institution
Certificate of registration of land in the name of the concerned institution/society
Activities of the society/institution, with annual accounts/balance sheet
Site plan architectural drawing map of the building proposed to be constructed and tentative expenditure

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide financial assistance to institutions/societies of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes for constructing/repairing buildings for community social or educational purposes.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes Department, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: What does 'Financial Assistance' mean under the scheme?
faqs.answer: 'Financial Assistance' means the amount sanctioned/released out of Government funds to supplement public efforts for development.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial Assistance up to ₹2.00 lakhs may be sanctioned by the Minister in charge.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only those institutions/societies of Scheduled Castes/Backward classes registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860, or the Indian Trust Act.
